page.title: 13PRINCIPAL FEATURE.
page.content: { The War Memorial.} In 1920, a memorial to the 1100 soldiers and sailors who had died in the 1914-18 war was planned. The chosen site was a 300' high hill, a prominent position in Bennadrove, north of the town of Stornoway. The memorial was constructed in the form of a Scottish Baronial Tower, 85' high on a square base. The tower tapered on up to its height to reach parapets and a circular turret containing a spiral staircase from which could be seen the parishes of the island to which the dead men belonged. Bronze plaques in Gaelic and English were unveiled in a dedication ceremony in Sept.1924. More plaques were erected to commemorate those who fell in the 1939-45 war. The memorial is open to the public daily.
